response.answer_text: Morals are what drive a human to do what they think is right. Morals are not needed for an individual, but expect to have a very troublesome life. Why? Ever heard of karma? Well there’s a very select few in this world who were physically born without a “conscious”. Therefore they can commit more heinous things and consciously be okay with it. For people that have genuinely healthy brains, when we do something bad, it tends to stay in our mind. When it stays in our mind, we are not totally focused at the task at hand and our performance suffers. Following morals keeps your mind worry free (for the most part) and able to live an easier, routine life. The hard part about morals is choosing what’s right for you and abiding by them.

No. Just because there are no precise, objective standards in morality doesn’t mean there’s no such thing as right and wrong. Similarly, just because there are no precise, objective standards in healthiness doesn’t mean there’s no such thing as healthy or unhealthy lifestyles. Some things are objectively worse or better for you, both in your actions and in your lifestyle.

Morals are completely damaging as they prevent thought, but not pointless for the same reason. If ones goal is to become authentic or a mature personality, one must be prepared to do away with all morality and so start to think for oneself.
